capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's family background and it's actually pretty interesting. He has a mixed lineage, which means his parents were both wizards but from different magical families. That's what makes him so unique, you know? His mom was Maud Potter, who was half-giant, and his dad was Fenrir Greyback, a werewolf. It's not every day you meet someone with that kind of heritage!

So, I've always been really proud of my mixed heritage - being a half-giant, half-muggle. It's definitely made for some interesting experiences and perspectives on life. I mean, who else can say they've got the best of both worlds? But at the same time, it can also be pretty tough to navigate the wizarding world when you're not fully one or the other.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what kind of wizard is valeria?
